doc:
William Keighley https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_Keighley 0 William Jackson Keighley (August 4, 1889, Philadelphia, Pennsylvania – June 24, 1984, New York, New York) was an American stage actor and Hollywood film director. After graduating from the Ludlum School of Dramatic Art, Keighley began acting at the age of 23. By the 1910s and 1920s, he was acting and directing on Broadway. With the advent of talking pictures, he relocated to Hollywood. He eventually signed with Warner Bros., where he proved adept at directing in a wide variety of genres. He was the initial director of The Adventures of Robin Hood, starring Errol Flynn and Olivia de Havilland, but was replaced by Michael Curtiz. During World War II, he supervised the First Motion Picture Unit of the U.S. Army Air Forces. He retired in 1953 and moved to Paris with his actress wife Genevieve Tobin. In retirement he became an award-winning, renowned still photographer. He died of a stroke. William_Jackson_Keighley ( August_4_,_1889 , Philadelphia , Pennsylvania – June_24_,_1984 , New_York , New_York ) was an_American_stage_actor and Hollywood_film_director . After graduating from the_Ludlum_School of Dramatic_Art , Keighley began_acting at the_age of 23 . By the_1910s_and_1920s , he was_acting_and_directing on Broadway . With the_advent of talking_pictures , he relocated to Hollywood . He eventually signed with Warner_Bros. , where he proved adept at directing in a_wide_variety of genres . He was the_initial_director of The_Adventures of Robin_Hood , starring Errol_Flynn and Olivia de Havilland , but was_replaced by Michael_Curtiz . During World_War_II , he supervised the_First_Motion_Picture_Unit of the_U.S._Army_Air_Forces . He retired in 1953 and moved to Paris with his_actress_wife_Genevieve_Tobin . In retirement he became an_award-winning_,_renowned_still_photographer . He died of a_stroke .
